p: Magnolia grandiflora L. (Magnoliaceae) is a large evergreen tree native to North America [ 9] that has medicinal and ornamental values. Medicinal use of various parts of M. grandiflora is reported in American Indian medicine and also listed as a bitter tonic and antimalarial. Several biologically active compounds have been reported from Magnolia species [ 10, 11, 12]. As a part of our natural product screening program for mosquitoes, we tested essential oils from various parts of M. grandiflora for their larvicidal and biting deterrent activities. This paper reports insecticidal and biting deterrent activities of essential oils and select pure compounds from various parts of M. grandiflora against yellow fever mosquito, Aedes aegypti.
